It was originally released as the fifth track on her studio album Mayhem (2025) and was the first song she wrote for the album.[3] Andrew Watt, Henry Walter, and Michael Polansky are co-writers. "Vanish into You" was written by Lady Gaga, Andrew Watt, Henry Walter, and Michael Polansky. Paper magazine has called the song "a discovery of love".[4] Riff magazine said the song sees Gaga "[channel] Blondie with a four-on-the-floor rhythm that's rooted in funk. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Vanish into You" is a 2025 song by Lady Gaga. It was originally released as the fifth track on her studio album Mayhem (2025) and was the first song she wrote for the album.[3] Andrew Watt, Henry Walter, and Michael Polansky are co-writers. "Vanish into You" was written by Lady Gaga, Andrew Watt, Henry Walter, and Michael Polansky. Paper magazine has called the song "a discovery of love".[4] Riff magazine said the song sees Gaga "[channel] Blondie with a four-on-the-floor rhythm that's rooted in funk. The track explores merging identity with a partner's to insulate from emotions".[5] Variety called the track a "David Bowie-referencing"[6] song that "builds towards its chorus with the same tension" as "Bad Romance" (2009).[7] Pitchfork has said "Vanish into You" has "pining yelps".[8] Clash magazine said the song "drops the tempo a little" and has "disco-fringed synths recalling ABBA's imperial phase; there's a slight retro touch at times here, too".[9] Some fans theorized that the song was inspired by Gaga's late collaborator Tony Bennett, highlighting lyrics which were reminiscent of some of Bennett's most popular songs.[10] Read more on Last.fm.
